headline.main: A Snake Story.; DEATH OF A LITTLE GIRL WHO HAD BEEN FASCINATED.

docs.lead_paragraph: At 11 o'clock yesterday forenoon the little daughter of B.D. DAVIS, of this city, whose familiarity with a snake has been frequently noticed, died at the residence of her parents, on Centre-street. The facts connected with her case we shall state, and leave the public to draw their own inference.

headline.main: BROOKLYN NEWS.; Quarterly Report of the Brooklyn Inspector of Police.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Quarterly Report of the Inspector of Police, for the quarter ending the 1st inst., was submitted yesterday to the Police Commissioners. By this report it appers that the Police force consists of 6 captains, 32 sergeants, 29 detailed men, 171 patrolmen, and 18 doormen, making a total of 256.

headline.main: Annual Report of the Superintendents of the Poor.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Superintendents of the Poor for the County of Kings submitted their annual report yesterday. There were submitted to the Almshouse during the year, 2,816 persons; discharged 2,806; remaining, 307. This institution is supported at a cost of $31,257; received from labor of inmates, $11,060.57; net expense to the county, $20,256.26.

docs.snippet: One of the most curious of the "signs of the times," with which the public has recently been edified, is the large space occupied by the subject of gymnastics in the debates of the American Institute of Instruction.

headline.main: THE MONTREAL RECEPTION.; Full Details--The Crystal Palace and the Victoria Bridge--The Grand Trunk Entertainment--Indian Games, & c. THE SCENE AT THE PALACE. PRINCE WAS COMING. THE RECEPTION THE PROCESSION AND ITS PECULIARITIES THE PRINCE APPEARED. THE CRYSTAL PALACE, THE VICTORIA BRIDGE. THE BOSTON FUSILIERS. INAUGURATE THE BRIDGE LUNCH HALL DOOR THE QUEEN, THE PRINCE-CONSORT: HIS ROYAL HIGHNESS THE PRINCE. THE PRINCE GIVES A TOAST. HINTS TO SIGHT-SEEKERS.

docs.lead_paragraph: MONTREAL HOUSE, MONTREAL, Monday, Aug. 27. Following in the royal train, we are back again at Montreal--back again in a rain storm, and back again in a crowded and jammed hotel, whose proprietors ought to be making money, if we may judge by the numbers of people who stay with them, and the quantities of money received by them. However, we are, comparatively, very comfortable, for while ...
